{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"Earlier PET scanners", "p":"uses", "o":"mechanical collimators", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Earlier PET scanners used planar imaging mode, which meant you had mechanical collimators defining the imaging planes."},
    {"s":"Modern PET scanners", "p":"uses", "o":"3D electronic collimation", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Modern PET scanners, though, have removed these mechanical collimators. Instead, you use coincidence detection in three dimensions."},
    {"s":"Mechanical collimators", "p":"represents", "o":"separating detector ring & defining imaging planes", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"These collimators would shape the radioactivity that could reach the detectors, so the ring only collected signals from a thin slice, or plane, of the patient."},
    {"s":"Mechanical collimators", "p":"unavailable", "o":"relying on 3D electronic collimation", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Modern PET scanners, though

parsed.o: separating detector ring & defining imaging planes
evidence: These collimators would shape the radioactivity that could reach the detectors, so the ring only collected signals from a thin slice, or plane, of the patient.
